Understanding this relationship is essential for properly assessing and mitigating security challenges.

You will learn what NumPy is, how to create NumPy arrays, and how to use slicing to access and manipulate data within them. This is an ideal resource for a quick overview of NumPy's essential features.

title: 7 Python Data Visualization Libraries in 15 minutes
summary: Get a rapid, humorous tour of Python's top data visualization libraries from a Kaggle Grandmaster. In just 15 minutes, this video provides an overview of seven popular tools, including Matplotlib, Plotly, Bokeh, and Altair, helping you quickly understand their core features and differences.

title: How To Choose The Right Graph Types of Graphs and When To Use Them
summary: Learn to choose the right graph for your data. This video explains the five most popular graph types, like bar charts and histograms, and clarifies the best situations to use each one for effective data visualization.

title: Databricks Model Serving  How to Deploy ML models as serving endpoint for RealTime Predictions
summary: Learn to deploy machine learning models as highly available, low-latency API endpoints using Databricks Model Serving. This tutorial explains how to serve your trained models for real-time inference, a critical step for putting ML into production.

title: How to Deploy Flask with Gunicorn and Nginx on Ubuntu
summary: Learn the production-ready method for deploying a Python Flask application. This tutorial guides you through configuring Gunicorn as a WSGI server to run your app and setting up Nginx as a reverse proxy on an Ubuntu server to efficiently handle incoming web traffic.

title: How to Deploy Your App to Streamlit Community Cloud
summary: Learn how to deploy your Streamlit application to the Streamlit Community Cloud. This tutorial provides a high-level overview of the deployment process, explains the benefits of deploying your app for sharing and portfolio building, and outlines various deployment options available to developers.

title: Cats-vs-Dogs
summary: This dataset contains thousands of images of cats and dogs, designed for a classic computer vision task: binary image classification. By using this data, you will learn to build and train a model, typically a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN), that can accurately distinguish between a cat and a dog. It's an excellent introductory project for anyone starting with deep learning for image recognition.

title: GitHub Bugs Prediction
summary: Dive into Natural Language Processing by building a model to predict software bugs from GitHub data. This hands-on project allows you to apply and compare classic text analysis techniques, such as TF-IDF and CountVectorizer, with the powerful, state-of-the-art BERT model.

title: Genomic Data for Cancer
summary: Learn to apply machine learning to bioinformatics using a real-world dataset. This resource contains gene expression data, enabling you to practice building and training models to classify different types of cancer.

title: Red Wine Quality
summary: Build and test your first machine learning models with this classic dataset. Use the chemical properties of red wine to predict its quality score (a regression task) or classify it into different tiers (a classification task). Its clean and simple format makes it perfect for beginners to practice core modeling skills.

title: Asteroid Dataset
summary: Analyze real-world asteroid data from NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory. This dataset is ideal for practicing data exploration, visualization, and building a machine learning model to predict whether an asteroid is potentially hazardous based on its physical and orbital characteristics.

title: Fraud Detection Transactions Dataset
summary: Learn to build a machine learning model for financial fraud detection. This high-quality, synthetic dataset is ideal for practicing binary classification and applying the powerful XGBoost algorithm to distinguish fraudulent transactions from legitimate ones.

title: Laptop Price Prediction cleaned Dataset
summary: Practice building a machine learning regression model with this cleaned dataset of laptop specifications. Your goal is to predict laptop prices based on features like CPU, RAM, and storage type. This is an excellent starting point for learning about feature engineering and applying regression algorithms to a real-world problem.

title: Salary Dataset - Simple linear regression

summary: This dataset provides features from thousands of websites, allowing you to build a machine learning model for a real-world cybersecurity task. With only a few examples per category, this dataset is ideal for exploring and implementing advanced computer vision techniques like few-shot, zero-shot, and transfer learning, which are crucial for building models that can learn effectively from limited data.

summary: This Kaggle dataset provides historical data for cryptocurrency price prediction. Learners can apply time-series analysis and machine learning techniques to build and train artificial intelligence models that forecast market trends, offering practical experience in financial data science.

title: SARS-COV-2 Ct-Scan Dataset

It is an excellent resource for a hands-on project in computer vision and deep learning, allowing you to build and train a model to classify medical images. You will gain practical experience in image preprocessing, working with convolutional neural networks (CNNs), and tackling a real-world binary classification problem.

title: Time Series Room Temperature Data

title: Cryprocurrency prices for the year

Use this data to apply advanced techniques like Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) and Deep Reinforcement Learning to predict stock market trends.

It contains pairs of chest X-ray images: one standard image and a corresponding version with bone shadows digitally removed. Your goal is to build and train an image-to-image translation model, such as a U-Net or a Generative Adversarial Network (GAN), that can automatically perform this bone suppression. This project provides hands-on experience in applying computer vision to solve a real-world problem in medical diagnostics, where enhancing the visibility of soft tissues can lead to more accurate diagnoses.

title: Data scientist salary

title: 2018 Kaggle Machine Learning & Data Science Survey

title: Crab Age Prediction

This is an excellent opportunity to practice **Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)**, **feature engineering**, and implementing classification algorithms like Logistic Regression, Random Forests, or Gradient Boosting to solve a real-world recommendation problem.

summary: This dataset provides paired examples of insecure and secured code snippets, useful for learning about identifying and fixing software vulnerabilities.

title: SQL Murder Mystery Database
summary: This is an interactive SQL learning experience where you use SQL queries to investigate a simulated murder case, applying your database skills to uncover clues and solve the mystery.

title: Formula 1 Race Data (SQLite)
summary: This dataset provides Formula 1 race and driver data from 1950-2017 in a SQLite format, ideal for practicing SQL queries and data analysis on historical motorsport information.

title: Rainfall in India
summary: Provides monthly rainfall data for Indian sub-divisions, spanning 115 years (1901-2015), ideal for climate analysis.

title: Indian Premier League SQLite Database
summary: An SQLite database for the Indian Premier League, containing data for 577 matches, player profiles, and team attributes.

title: SQLite Sakila Sample Database
summary: A SQLite port of the classic MySQL Sakila sample database, perfect for hands-on practice with SQLite queries and relational database concepts.

title: Sloan Digital Sky Survey DR16
summary: Explore the Sloan Digital Sky Survey (SDSS) Data Release 16 (DR16), a vast astronomical dataset featuring observational data on galaxies, stars, and quasars. Ideal for students studying astronomy, astrophysics, and data analysis.

title: Human Resources Data Set
summary: A Human Resources dataset available on Kaggle, ideal for practicing data visualization and basic regression.

title: Bike Store Relational Database | SQL
summary: This sample relational database, derived from sqlservertutorial.net, provides a practical context of a retail bike store for students to learn and practice SQL queries and fundamental database concepts.

title: Sample databases for the SQL Server course
summary: Provides pre-built SQL Server databases for hands-on practice, ideal for students learning SQL queries and database management within a SQL Server course.

title: Google Patents Public Data
summary: A public Google BigQuery dataset providing worldwide bibliographic and US patent publications for intellectual property research and analysis.

title: WikiSQL (Questions and SQL Queries)
summary: WikiSQL is a large, hand-annotated dataset consisting of 80,654 natural language questions and their corresponding SQL queries, sourced from 24,241 Wikipedia tables. It is a fundamental resource for developing and training Natural Language Interfaces to databases, specifically for converting natural language into executable SQL queries.

title: Online Shop 2024
summary: This resource presents an 8-table relational database schema for an online shop, illustrating how core entities like products, customers, and orders are structured. Ideal for learning e-commerce database design principles and practical data modeling.

title: Car information dataset
summary: This dataset offers comprehensive car information, perfect for students to practice data visualization, statistical analysis, and machine learning regression tasks with automotive data.

title: Python Data Visualization Essentials Guide
summary: This guide offers practical exercises to learn essential data visualization techniques using Python.

title: Zomato Dataset
summary: This resource teaches data analysis techniques using Matplotlib and Seaborn on a Zomato dataset.

title: Bird Migration Dataset (Data Visualization / EDA)
summary: This dataset offers a comprehensive resource on bird migration, ideal for practicing and enhancing your data science, exploratory data analysis (EDA), and data visualization skills.

title: Laptop Price Prediction
summary: Learn to predict laptop prices by applying regression models.

title: Gapminder World
summary: Explore the Gapminder World dataset (1952-2007) to analyze global development trends, ideal for data analysis and visualization practice.

title: Data Visualization Cheat sheets and Resources
summary: This resource provides a valuable collection of 32 data visualization cheat sheets, 32 common charts, and 7 recommended books, serving as an excellent reference and learning aid for students.

title: Pakistan House Price dataset
summary: This dataset offers updated house price information for Pakistan, ideal for students to practice data cleaning, exploratory data analysis, and build machine learning models for real estate price prediction and market trend analysis.

title: global_cancer_patients_2015_2024
summary: This dataset provides a global overview of cancer cases and patient statistics from 2015 to 2024, offering insights into worldwide cancer prevalence and trends over a decade.

title: US Regional Sales Data
summary: Learn to analyze US regional sales data, identify key trends, and apply predictive modeling techniques for sales forecasting.

title: SpaceTitanic|FE
summary: This resource offers pre-engineered features from the Spaceship Titanic dataset, ideal for accelerating model development.

title: FE Course Data
summary: Datasets for hands-on learning and application of Feature Engineering concepts within Kaggle's course.

title: Grapevine Leaves Image Dataset
summary: This is an image dataset containing visual data of grapevine leaves from five distinct varieties: Ak, Ala Idris, Büzgülü, Dimnit, and Nazli. It can be used for tasks such as image classification or botanical analysis.

title: Walmart Sales Forecast
summary: This resource explores how to forecast Walmart sales using the structured CRISP-DM (Cross-Industry Standard Process for Data Mining) methodology, providing a practical example of applying data science to a business problem.

title: Social Media vs Productivity
summary: Examines the impact of social media usage on individual productivity, utilizing data for analysis.

title: Climate Insights Dataset
summary: This dataset provides comprehensive temperature data, serving as a resource for exploring and analyzing the impacts of climate change and understanding global climate trends.

title: House Price Regression Dataset
summary: This dataset is designed for students to learn and practice house price prediction using regression analysis. It allows for exploration of factors influencing home values and building machine learning models to forecast prices.

title: Deep learning Models for Testing and deployment
summary: This resource offers pretrained deep learning models designed for testing and deployment purposes.

title: Car Price Prediction Challenge
summary: This dataset offers a practical challenge for students to learn and apply regression techniques by predicting car prices based on provided features.

title: 10k German News Articles
summary: This dataset offers 10,000 German news articles, ideal for training and evaluating Natural Language Processing (NLP) models, particularly for tasks like topic extraction in German.

title: Movie Genre Classification
summary: This dataset provides 50,000 fictional movie entries, ideal for practicing and developing machine learning models to classify movies into their respective genres.

title: Thermal images of rats (mice) for segmentation
summary: Explore a biomedical thermal imaging dataset of rats and mice, ideal for learning AI segmentation and and thermal analysis.

title: AIM Technologies / Predict The Dialectal Arabic
summary: Learn to apply computational techniques to predict and classify different Arabic dialects.

title: Fruits-262
summary: This dataset offers over 225,000 images of 262 distinct fruit types, serving as an excellent resource for training and evaluating machine learning models in image classification and computer vision applications.

title: Korean Translation Dataset for NLP Models
summary: A Kaggle dataset featuring Korean translated instructions and input-output pairs, ideal for training and evaluating Natural Language Processing (NLP) models.

title: Red and White Wine Quality Analysis
summary: A beginner-friendly guide to performing wine quality analysis, demonstrating a standard machine learning pipeline using red and white wine datasets.

title: 30VNFoods
summary: A dataset featuring 25,136 images of 30 distinct Vietnamese foods, complete with URLs, valuable for computer vision and data analysis.

title: Detectanddescribe Joint learning framework for detection and   description of objects
summary: This learning framework presents a joint approach for object detection and detailed description. It extends traditional 'what' and 'where' detection by also identifying fine-grained attributes such as object type and shape.

title: PROB Probabilistic Objectness for Open World Object Detection
summary: PROB (Probabilistic Objectness) introduces a probabilistic method for Open World Object Detection (OWOD). OWOD is a challenging computer vision task focused on detecting objects in real-world settings, including novel or unknown ones, bridging traditional object detection with practical applications.

title: Context in object detection a systematic literature review
summary: This systematic literature review explores how incorporating contextual information in computer vision significantly enhances the clarity, analysis, and precision of object detection by leveraging inherent image or video data.

title: A Coarse to Fine Framework for Object Detection in High Resolution Image
summary: This paper introduces a **coarse-to-fine framework** for **object detection in high-resolution images**. It addresses the challenge of current methods that struggle with effectively detecting **tiny objects** and handling **large scale variations** within such images.

title: Detecting outofcontext objects using contextual cues
summary: This paper presents an approach to identify "outofcontext" (OOC) objects within an image. The core goal is to determine if an object is inconsistent with its surroundings by leveraging contextual cues present in the scene.

title: Color and Shape Content Based Image Classification using RBF Network and   PSO Technique A Survey
summary: This survey explores techniques for content-based image classification using color and shape features, specifically focusing on Radial Basis Function (RBF) networks and Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO). The goal is to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of image query retrieval systems, building on supervised learning principles.

title: Classificationdriven Single Image Dehazing
summary: This paper explores image dehazing, noting that most current methods, whether using handcrafted features or CNNs with pixel-level Mean Square Error (MSE) loss, achieve visually appealing results. It suggests a focus on improving these techniques, potentially via a classification-driven approach, to enhance clarity.

title: PrivacyPreserving Image Classification Using Isotropic Network
summary: This paper proposes a method for privacy-preserving image classification. It achieves this by classifying encrypted images using isotropic networks, such as the Vision Transformer.

title: Learning degraded image classification with restoration data fidelity
summary: This paper addresses the challenge of classifying *degraded* images, moving beyond typical CNN-based methods that primarily focus on *clean* datasets. It proposes a novel learning approach that leverages "restoration data fidelity" to improve the accuracy of image classification in non-ideal conditions.

title: PrivacyPreserving Image Classification Using Vision Transformer
summary: This paper presents a method for **privacy-preserving image classification** that combines **encrypted images** with the **Vision Transformer (ViT)** model. It explores how to classify images while safeguarding data privacy.

title: Image Segmentation Algorithms Overview
summary: Image segmentation is a crucial technology with broad applications, including medical imaging, face recognition, and pedestrian detection. This overview introduces various algorithmic approaches, such as region-based and edge detection methods, clustering techniques, and modern weakly-supervised learning utilizing Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs).

title: Prefer Nested Segmentation to Compound Segmentation
summary: This paper addresses the assessment of intraorgan radiation dose sensitivity in clinical radiotherapy. It recommends using **Nested Segmentation** over Compound Segmentation as a more effective method for partitioning regions of interest to compare their relative contributions to clinical outcomes.

title: Ensembling Instance and Semantic Segmentation for Panoptic Segmentation
summary: This paper presents an ensembling method for **panoptic segmentation**, a task that combines object instance recognition and pixel-level semantic classification. The proposed approach first performs **instance segmentation** and **semantic segmentation** independently, then integrates their respective outputs to generate the final panoptic segmentation results, demonstrated on the **COCO dataset**.

title: YOLO advances to its genesis a decadal and comprehensive review of the   You Only Look Once YOLO series
summary: Learn about the evolution of You Only Look Once (YOLO) object detection algorithms. This comprehensive review systematically traces YOLO's advancements from its genesis (YOLOv1) to the latest YOLOv12, using a unique reverse chronological analysis.

title: Agricultural Object Detection with You Look Only Once YOLO Algorithm   A Bibliometric and Systematic Literature Review
summary: This paper systematically reviews the application of the YOLO (You Look Only Once) algorithm for object detection in agriculture. It highlights YOLO's rapid rise and significance as a core vision-based technology in modern digital farming tools.

title: A Comprehensive Review of YOLO Architectures in Computer Vision From   YOLOv1 to YOLOv8 and YOLONAS
summary: Explore the evolution of YOLO (You Only Look Once) architectures, from YOLOv1 to YOLOv8 and YOLONAS. This review details its role as a central real-time object detection system vital for robotics, driverless cars, and video monitoring applications.

title: YOLO  You only look 10647 times
summary: This paper re-interprets the YOLO (You Only Look Once) single-stage object detection approach. It frames YOLO as a system performing parallel classification on 10,647 fixed region proposals, offering insight into how its output pixels attend to specific regions.

title: Volumetric and MultiView CNNs for Object Classification on 3D Data
summary: This resource explains how Volumetric and MultiView Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) are used for object classification on 3D data. It highlights the increasing availability of 3D models and the role of CNNs as the current state-of-the-art in this area.

title: Aspectbased Opinion Summarization with Convolutional Neural Networks
summary: This paper explores Aspect-based Opinion Summarization (AOS) of product reviews using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs). A practical AOS system requires addressing core subtasks such as aspect extraction to effectively summarize opinions.

title: Wavelet Convolutional Neural Networks
summary: This paper introduces Wavelet Convolutional Neural Networks (Wavelet CNNs), a novel approach that integrates wavelet transforms with traditional Convolutional Neural Networks. The goal is to enhance image processing tasks like classification and object recognition by effectively combining spatial and spectral information, leveraging the recent performance improvements of CNNs in these areas.

title: Automatically Evolving CNN Architectures Based on Blocks
summary: Explore how Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) architectures can be automatically evolved. This method aims to reduce the need for extensive human expertise in designing high-performing CNNs, often by using a block-based approach.

title: Extension of Convolutional Neural Network along Temporal and Vertical   Directions for Precipitation Downscaling
summary: This study introduces a 3D Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) for precipitation downscaling, building upon prior successful applications of 2D CNNs by extending the network along temporal and vertical dimensions for improved climate data estimation.

title: Implications of Computer Vision Driven Assistive Technologies Towards   Individuals with Visual Impairment
summary: Computer vision is increasingly utilized in assistive technologies to support individuals with visual impairment, with research validating its effectiveness in this crucial application area.

title: BERTDRE BERT with Deep Recursive Encoder for Natural Language Sentence   Matching
summary: This paper introduces BERTDRE, a novel deep neural architecture that enhances BERT with a deep recursive encoder specifically for Natural Language Sentence Matching (NLSM). The research also includes an analysis of model behavior, revealing insights into existing limitations of BERT.

title: BERTJAM Boosting BERTEnhanced Neural Machine Translation with Joint   Attention
summary: BERTJAM improves BERT-enhanced Neural Machine Translation (NMT) by using a novel joint attention mechanism to effectively fuse BERT's powerful language representations with the Transformer encoder and decoder layers, aiming to boost translation performance.

title: ExtremeBERT A Toolkit for Accelerating Pretraining of Customized BERT
summary: ExtremeBERT is an easy-to-use toolkit designed to accelerate and customize the pretraining of BERT models for the research community.

title: LIMITBERT  Linguistic Informed MultiTask BERT
summary: LIMITBERT is a BERT-based model that uses Multi-Task Learning (MTL) to learn robust language representations. It incorporates linguistic knowledge (syntax, semantics) to improve performance across various linguistic tasks, such as Part-of-Speech (POS) tagging.

title: Evaluation of BERT and ALBERT Sentence Embedding Performance on   Downstream NLP Tasks
summary: This paper evaluates the performance of sentence embeddings derived from pre-trained language models like BERT and ALBERT on various downstream Natural Language Processing (NLP) tasks. It highlights the crucial role these contextualized representations play in achieving high performance in modern NLP applications.

title: Towards Lightweight Transformer via Groupwise Transformation for   VisionandLanguage Tasks
summary: This paper introduces "Groupwise Transformation" as a method to develop lightweight and more computationally efficient Transformers, aiming to reduce their high parameter and computation costs, particularly for Vision and Language tasks.

title: Enhancing Answer Selection in Community Question Answering with   Pretrained and Large Language Models
summary: This paper addresses the crucial challenge of efficiently selecting relevant answers in Community Question Answering (CQA) platforms, where users often face an overwhelming number of responses. It investigates how Pretrained Language Models (PLMs) and Large Language Models (LLMs) can be effectively leveraged to enhance this answer selection process, ultimately making CQA more useful by accurately identifying the most pertinent information.

title: QAMPARI An Opendomain Question Answering Benchmark for Questions with   Many Answers from Multiple Paragraphs
summary: QAMPARI is a new open-domain question answering (ODQA) benchmark designed for questions that require extracting multiple answers from several paragraphs, addressing a limitation in existing benchmarks that primarily focus on single-paragraph answers.

title: Generating Answer Candidates for Quizzes and AnswerAware Question   Generators
summary: Answer only the summary below: This paper explores methods for automatically generating answer candidates for open-ended quiz questions, aiming to alleviate the tedious manual process of preparing such assessments. It contributes to the field of automatic question generation, particularly for "AnswerAware" systems that consider potential answers during question creation.

title: ZeroShot Task Transfer
summary: This paper introduces TTNet, a novel metalearning algorithm designed for 'zero-shot task transfer.' This means it can perform new tasks even when no specific training data (ground truth) is available for those tasks. TTNet achieves this by learning to directly predict the necessary model parameters to solve these novel problems.

title: Killing it with ZeroShot Adversarially Robust Novelty Detection
summary: This paper introduces a significant advancement in **Novelty Detection (ND)**, a crucial machine learning capability for identifying new or unseen data during system operation. Essential for the safe and reliable function of automated systems, the research focuses on **ZeroShot Adversarially Robust ND**, meaning it can detect novel inputs without requiring prior examples of what is considered "new," and is resilient to adversarial attacks designed to trick the system.

title: Model and Evaluation Towards Fairness in Multilingual Text   Classification
summary: This paper explores models and evaluation methods designed to achieve fairness in multilingual text classification, addressing a significant research gap where existing bias-reduction efforts primarily focus on monolingual systems.

title: Text Classification using Association Rule with a Hybrid Concept of   Naive Bayes Classifier and Genetic Algorithm
summary: Text classification automates assigning natural language texts to predefined categories based on content, crucial for text retrieval systems. This specific approach leverages a hybrid methodology combining Association Rules with Naive Bayes Classifier and Genetic Algorithms.

title: Text Classification A Perspective of Deep Learning Methods
summary: Deep learning methods are crucial for effective text classification, especially given the exponential increase in complex text data found online.

title: A survey on phrase structure learning methods for text classification
summary: This survey examines phrase structure learning methods applied to text classification, the task of automatically assigning text to predefined categories. Text classification is a widely studied problem across natural language processing, data mining, and information retrieval communities.

title: Spark NLP Natural Language Understanding at Scale
summary: Spark NLP is a scalable and performant Natural Language Processing (NLP) library built on Apache Spark ML, designed to provide accurate NLP annotations for machine learning pipelines, especially in distributed environments.

title: Training an NLP Scholar at a Small Liberal Arts College A Backwards   Designed Course Proposal
summary: This proposal outlines a 'backwards-designed' course for training Natural Language Processing (NLP) scholars, specifically addressing how to engage diverse students in NLP at small liberal arts colleges amid the field's rapid growth.

title: Sejarah dan Perkembangan Teknik Natural Language Processing NLP Bahasa   Indonesia Tinjauan tentang sejarah perkembangan teknologi dan aplikasi NLP   dalam bahasa Indonesia
summary: Learn about the history, core technologies, and practical applications of Natural Language Processing (NLP) specifically developed for the Indonesian language.

title: GRNLPTOOLKIT An OpenSource NLP Toolkit for Modern Greek
summary: GRNLPTOOLKIT is an open-source Natural Language Processing (NLP) toolkit specifically designed for Modern Greek. It offers state-of-the-art performance across five core NLP tasks: part-of-speech tagging, morphological tagging, dependency parsing, named entity recognition, and Greek-to-Greek transliteration.

title: The Law and NLP Bridging Disciplinary Disconnects
summary: This paper explores the disconnect between legal practice, which is deeply language-dependent, and the slow adoption of Natural Language Processing (NLP) tools by legal professionals. It highlights how NLP can bridge this gap, potentially improving the legal system and addressing issues like access to justice.

title: Learning a powerful SVM using piecewise linear loss functions
summary: This paper introduces the k-Piecewise Linear Loss Support Vector Machine (kPLSVM) model, an adaptive SVM that uses general k-piecewise linear convex loss functions to measure empirical risk, leading to more effective learning.

title: Improving Efficiency of SVM kfold Crossvalidation by Alpha Seeding
summary: To improve the efficiency of the computationally expensive k-fold cross-validation for Support Vector Machines (SVMs), which requires training k separate models, this work introduces "Alpha Seeding." This technique accelerates the process by reusing information between folds, making hyperparameter evaluation faster.

title: A metric learning perspective of SVM on the relation of SVM and LMNN
summary: This paper unifies Support Vector Machines (SVMs) and Large Margin Nearest Neighbor (LMNN) algorithms by viewing them through a metric learning perspective, despite their inherently different learning biases.

title: pSVM Softmargin SVMs with pnorm Hinge Loss
summary: pSVM Softmargin Support Vector Machines (SVMs) introduce a p-norm Hinge Loss for binary classification tasks. Similar to other SVMs, this approach aims to achieve a balance between margin maximization and classification error.

title: Mondrian Forests Efficient Online Random Forests
summary: Mondrian Forests are an efficient, online type of random forest. Building on the strong predictive performance of traditional random forests—ensembles of decision trees used for classification and regression—Mondrian Forests are specifically designed to learn incrementally from continuous data streams, making them highly suitable for dynamic and large datasets.

title: Geometry and AccuracyPreserving Random Forest Proximities
summary: Random Forests are highly effective, out-of-the-box machine learning algorithms known for their strong predictive performance in classification and regression tasks. This research explores methods to maintain their geometric properties and accuracy when calculating "proximities," a measure of similarity between data points within the forest.

title: Improved Weighted Random Forest for Classification Problems
summary: This summary introduces the concept of an Improved Weighted Random Forest, an ensemble learning method designed to enhance classification accuracy. It highlights that combining diverse machine learning models is key to significantly boosting predictive performance compared to using individual models.

title: A Comparative Analysis of XGBoost
summary: XGBoost is a scalable, reliable, and efficient gradient boosting ensemble machine learning algorithm. This resource offers a practical analysis of its operational mechanics, specifically focusing on its training speed.

title: Tabular Data Deep Learning is Not All You Need
summary: When working with tabular data, tree ensemble models like XGBoost are often preferred and highly effective for classification tasks in real-world scenarios, challenging the idea that deep learning is universally the best approach for this data type.

title: Hybrid gene selection approach using XGBoost and multiobjective genetic   algorithm for cancer classification
summary: This research presents a hybrid method combining XGBoost and a multiobjective genetic algorithm to efficiently select the most relevant genes from microarray expression data. This approach aims to improve cancer classification accuracy by addressing the challenge of many genes, few samples, and numerous irrelevant genes in such datasets.

title: Feature Interactions in XGBoost
summary: This paper investigates methods to identify and utilize feature interactions within XGBoost models. It demonstrates that accurately identifying these interactions allows them to be used as constraints, leading to improved performance in gradient boosting tree models.

title: LinXGBoost Extension of XGBoost to Generalized Local Linear Models
summary: LinXGBoost extends the popular XGBoost algorithm to incorporate generalized local linear models, addressing the limitation of XGBoost's piecewise constant predictions. While standard XGBoost performs well in high-dimensional spaces, its constant predictions can be less optimal in low-dimensional settings. LinXGBoost aims to provide a more flexible and potentially more accurate approach for these scenarios.

title: BoostingBased Sequential MetaTree Ensemble Construction for Improved   Decision Trees
summary: This paper addresses the common overfitting problem in traditional decision trees, a popular machine learning method. It introduces a novel "boosting-based sequential ensemble construction" approach for MetaTrees, a recently proposed solution to decision tree overfitting. The goal is to further improve decision tree performance and robustness by building more effective, less overfit models.

title: An Algorithmic Framework for Constructing Multiple Decision Trees by   Evaluating Their Combination Performance Throughout the Construction Process
summary: This algorithmic framework focuses on constructing multiple decision trees by continuously evaluating and optimizing their combined predictive performance throughout the construction process, building on established ensemble methods like bagging.

title: Provably optimal decision trees with arbitrary splitting rules in   polynomial time
summary: This paper introduces a novel, generic framework for decision trees that unifies various data structures (e.g., binary search trees, KD trees, and machine learning decision trees). It presents the first provably optimal and polynomial-time algorithm for constructing these decision trees, even with arbitrary splitting rules, marking a significant advancement in efficient and optimal tree construction.

title: Tree in Tree from Decision Trees to Decision Graphs
summary: Learn about Tree in Tree (TnT) decision graphs, a novel framework that extends conventional decision trees, building on their strengths as lightweight and interpretable classifiers.

title: Comparative Analysis of Deterministic and Nondeterministic Decision   Trees for Decision Tables from Closed Classes
summary: This paper compares deterministic and nondeterministic decision trees, focusing on their application to specific "closed classes" of decision tables. These tables are characterized by having many-valued decisions and remaining invariant under operations like column removal, decision changes, and column permutation.

title: Evaluating Hospital Case Cost Prediction Models Using Azure Machine   Learning Studio
summary: Learn about evaluating machine learning regression models for accurate hospital case cost prediction. This is crucial for efficient healthcare financial management and budgetary planning, with the evaluation performed using Azure Machine Learning Studio.

title: How to get the most out of Twinned Regression Methods
summary: Twinned Regression Methods solve a dual problem to standard regression by predicting differences between regression targets instead of the targets themselves.

title: Nonparametric and Varying Coefficient Modal Regression
summary: "Nonparametric modal regression" is a new data analysis tool designed to investigate relationships between variables by estimating the mode of the conditional density of a response variable given predictors.

title: A Statistical Learning Approach to Modal Regression
summary: This paper systematically studies nonparametric modal regression from a statistical learning perspective. It particularly investigates the Maximum Correntropy Criterion based Regression (MCCR), revealing its relationship to modal regression when its scale parameter approaches zero.

title: Lecture Notes Optimization for Machine Learning
summary: An informative collection of lecture notes on optimization methods critical for machine learning, drawing from a Princeton University course, MLSS Buenos Aires, and Simons Foundation Berkeley tutorials.

title: An Optimal Control View of Adversarial Machine Learning
summary: This summary views adversarial machine learning through an optimal control lens, treating the machine learner as a dynamical system. Adversarial actions are modeled as inputs to this system, while the adversary's objectives are defined as control costs. This framework offers a novel way to analyze and understand adversarial attacks.

title: Minimax deviation strategies for machine learning and recognition with   short learning samples
summary: This paper introduces 'minimax deviation learning' as a novel strategy to address the challenges of small learning samples in machine learning, overcoming limitations found in traditional maximum likelihood and minimax learning methods.

title: Machine Learning for Clinical Predictive Analytics
summary: This resource provides a concise overview of applying machine learning techniques to clinical prediction tasks, beginning with an introduction to fundamental ML concepts.

title: Towards Modular Machine Learning Solution Development Benefits and   Tradeoffs
summary: This resource introduces modular machine learning solution development as a strategy to enhance ML adoption and cost-efficiency. It details the benefits and tradeoffs associated with implementing a modular approach in ML solutions.

title: Lecture Notes Neural Network Architectures
summary: These lecture notes provide a mathematical overview of Neural Network architectures, framing Machine Learning with Neural Networks as an optimization problem. It offers an introductory yet grounded understanding of the topic.

title: Graph Structure of Neural Networks
summary: This paper investigates the relationship between the graph structure of neural networks and their predictive performance, addressing a gap in current understanding.

title: Opening the black box of deep learning
summary: This paper addresses the "black box" challenge in deep learning, arguing that understanding its internal mechanisms is crucial for its continued advancement and to uncover the fundamental principles behind its remarkable success.

title: ConceptOriented Deep Learning
summary: Concept-oriented Deep Learning (CODL) extends traditional machine deep learning by integrating human-like conceptual understanding. This approach aims to improve knowledge integration and transfer, mirroring how humans build understanding from fundamental concepts.

title: Deep learning research landscape  roadmap in a nutshell past present   and future  Towards deep cortical learning
summary: This work maps the past, present, and future of deep learning, predicting that the field's next major convergence will be 'deep cortical learning.' This future direction involves combining deep learning with cortical learning, ultimately aiming to construct artificial cortical columns.

title: A First Look at Deep Learning Apps on Smartphones
summary: This paper presents the first empirical study of deep learning (DL) adoption in 16,500 popular Android apps. It aims to bridge the gap between DL research and practical smartphone applications by analyzing how these apps currently utilize DL.

title: Geometrization of deep networks for the interpretability of deep   learning systems
summary: This paper proposes "geometrization of deep networks" as a novel approach to enhance the interpretability of deep learning systems. This method acts as a unifying framework, connecting concepts from physics, geometry, deep networks, and quantum computation to provide a deeper understanding of how deep learning works.

title: Neural Speed Reading via SkimRNN
summary: SkimRNN is a recurrent neural network (RNN) designed for efficient processing, mimicking human speed reading. It achieves computational advantage by dynamically updating only a small portion of its internal state for less important input tokens.

title: Learning Useful Representations of Recurrent Neural Network Weight   Matrices
summary: This paper investigates methods for learning useful representations of Recurrent Neural Network (RNN) weight matrices. The aim is to improve the analysis of RNNs and enhance performance on downstream tasks, considering the weight matrix as the RNN's internal "program."

title: FastSlow Recurrent Neural Networks
summary: This paper introduces "FastSlow Recurrent Neural Networks," a novel type of RNN designed to efficiently process variable-length sequential data. This innovation is highly relevant for applications like speech recognition, language modeling, generative image modeling, and machine translation, where handling sequences of varying lengths is crucial.

title: Learning Compact Recurrent Neural Networks with BlockTerm Tensor   Decomposition
summary: Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) are powerful for sequence modeling but become computationally expensive, especially with high-dimensional inputs. This work proposes a method to create more "compact" and efficient RNNs by using BlockTerm Tensor Decomposition, reducing training costs and making them more practical for complex data.

title: Bidirectional LSTMCRF Models for Sequence Tagging
summary: This paper explores various Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) based models for sequence tagging, including standard LSTMs, Bidirectional LSTMs (BiLSTM), LSTMs combined with a Conditional Random Field (CRF) layer (LSTM-CRF), and Bidirectional LSTM-CRF models. The research proposes and investigates the effectiveness of these architectures for sequence tagging tasks.

title: Layer Trajectory LSTM
summary: This paper introduces Layer Trajectory LSTM, a novel approach designed to overcome the difficulties associated with training and optimizing very deep LSTM networks, which are otherwise beneficial for enhanced modeling power.

title: Generative Adversarial Networks and Adversarial Autoencoders Tutorial   and Survey
summary: This tutorial and survey provides a comprehensive introduction to Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) and Adversarial Autoencoders (AAEs). It starts by explaining the foundational concept of adversarial learning, then explores various GAN and AAE architectures and their variants.

title: GAN You Do the GAN GAN
summary: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) are a prominent class of generative models that have achieved impressive results in synthesizing various forms of data, such as realistic natural and artistic images and textures, through their advanced variants.

title: Sequential training of GANs against GANclassifiers reveals correlated   knowledge gaps present among independently trained GAN instances
summary: Sequential training of Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs) against specialized "GANclassifiers" reveals that even independently trained GAN instances exhibit correlated "knowledge gaps" or blind spots in their image generation. This indicates that despite varied training, GANs tend to share similar weaknesses or failure modes in producing certain types of images.

title: LossSensitive Generative Adversarial Networks on Lipschitz Densities
summary: This paper introduces LossSensitive Generative Adversarial Networks (LSGANs), presenting Lipschitz regularization theory and algorithms for training the network's loss function.

title: Capsule GAN Using Capsule Network for Generator Architecture
summary: Capsule GAN is a novel Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) that uniquely integrates Capsule Networks into *both* its generator and discriminator architectures. This approach aims to improve the challenges associated with generating high-quality images using traditional GANs.

title: Adversarial Autoencoders in Operator Learning
summary: This paper explores applying adversarial autoencoder principles to neural operator architectures like DeepONets and Koopman autoencoders. Building on the established performance improvements of adversarial additions in other machine learning autoencoders, the research investigates how this approach can enhance the performance of these operator learning models.

title: Stacked autoencoders based machine learning for noise reduction and   signal reconstruction in geophysical data
summary: Stacked autoencoders are a type of neural network used in machine learning to effectively reduce noise and reconstruct signals, particularly in geophysical data. These networks learn to compress input data into a lower-dimensional hidden representation and then reconstruct it, allowing them to identify and preserve essential signal information while filtering out noise.

title: Revisiting Role of Autoencoders in Adversarial Settings
summary: Autoencoders are frequently used for denoising to defend against adversarial attacks, a method sometimes called gradient masking. This paper experimentally re-examines and clarifies the precise role and effectiveness of autoencoders in such adversarial defense scenarios.

title: Implicit ZCA Whitening Effects of Linear Autoencoders for Recommendation
summary: This paper explores how linear autoencoders, used in recommendation systems to learn item similarity, implicitly achieve ZCA whitening effects. It reveals a connection between these autoencoder models and this data transformation technique.

title: Data Cleaning Using Large Language Models
summary: Data cleaning is a crucial yet challenging manual task, with prior statistical rule-based automation yielding low accuracy. Large Language Models are being investigated as a solution to automate and improve the accuracy of data cleaning.

title: AlphaClean Automatic Generation of Data Cleaning Pipelines
summary: AlphaClean is an automatic system designed to generate data cleaning pipelines, aiming to significantly reduce the analyst effort involved in designing and hyperparameter tuning complex automated data cleaning solutions. It addresses the unique challenges of hyperparameter tuning specific to data cleaning, distinguishing it from general machine learning hyperparameter tuning.

title: AutoDCWorkflow LLMbased Data Cleaning Workflow AutoGeneration and   Benchmark
summary: This paper explores leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) to automatically generate data cleaning workflows. It introduces AutoDCWorkflow, a pipeline designed to prompt LLMs for data cleaning operations, aiming to evaluate their reasoning capabilities and benchmark their performance in this domain.

title: Data Cleaning and Machine Learning A Systematic Literature Review
summary: This systematic literature review highlights that the performance of Machine Learning (ML) models is critically dependent on the quality of their training data, emphasizing the growing importance of data cleaning techniques for effective ML applications.

title: An Empirical Analysis of Feature Engineering for Predictive Modeling
summary: This content explains feature engineering as the crucial process of preparing input data (feature vectors) for supervised machine learning models—like neural networks, decision trees, random forests, and gradient boosting machines—to enable accurate predictions. It presents an empirical analysis of its effectiveness.

title: Augmenting datadriven models for energy systems through feature   engineering A Python framework for feature engineering
summary: This resource introduces a Python framework for applying feature engineering to enhance data-driven models in energy systems. These models commonly utilize machine learning methods such as linear regression, neural networks, and decision trees.

title: Enhancing PhysicsInformed Neural Networks Through Feature Engineering
summary: Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs) apply deep learning to solve Partial Differential Equations (PDEs). While current mainstream PINN architectures using fully-connected multilayer models often require extensive training, this work focuses on enhancing their performance and efficiency through feature engineering.

title: Data Engineering for the Analysis of Semiconductor Manufacturing Data
summary: This paper demonstrates how data engineering techniques, specifically using decision tree induction software (QYIELD), can analyze semiconductor manufacturing data to predict product rejections. The generated rules aim to assist process engineers in improving manufacturing efficiency and quality control.

title: Toward Sensorbased Sleep Monitoring with Electrodermal Activity   Measures
summary: This study investigates the effectiveness of using electrodermal activity (EDA) data from wearable sensors to monitor sleep. Researchers analyzed 77 nights of sleep data from six participants, combining EDA measurements with self-reported sleep information, using factor analysis to evaluate EDA's potential for sleep tracking.

title: IICPilot An Intelligent Integrated Circuit Backend Design Framework   Using Open EDA
summary: IICPilot is an intelligent framework for integrated circuit backend design, developed to manage the growing complexity and numerous design parameters inherent in rapidly advancing open-source EDA tools.

title: Scaling Up Estimation of Distribution Algorithms For Continuous   Optimization
summary: This paper explores methods to improve the efficiency and applicability of Estimation of Distribution Algorithms (EDAs), a type of optimization technique, specifically for tackling complex continuous global optimization problems.

title: EDA Easy Data Augmentation Techniques for Boosting Performance on Text   Classification Tasks
summary: EDA (Easy Data Augmentation) is a set of techniques designed to improve text classification performance by augmenting training data. It utilizes four simple yet powerful operations: synonym replacement, random insertion, and random word swapping.

title: Giant Panda Face Recognition Using Small Dataset
summary: This paper explores the application of face recognition technology to identify individual giant pandas, a crucial task for accurately estimating wild populations and assessing conservation efforts. It specifically addresses the challenge of achieving effective recognition with a limited dataset, highlighting a novel approach to support endangered species management.

title: Distinguishing Individual Red Pandas from Their Faces
summary: This paper explores the importance of identifying individual animals, particularly endangered red pandas, for research and conservation, and proposes using facial features as a primary method for this identification.

title: Mechanical Evidence for the Phylogenetic Origin of the Red Pandas False   Thumb as an Adaptation to Arboreal Locomotion
summary: This study investigates the evolutionary origin of the red panda's "false thumb" using a biomimetic (robot) paw. It presents mechanical evidence suggesting this unique thumb is an adaptation primarily used to aid in arboreal (tree-climbing) locomotion.

title: Towards Scalable Dataframe Systems
summary: This work focuses on enhancing the scalability of popular dataframe systems (e.g., in R and Python) by addressing their performance limitations on large datasets and resolving ambiguities in their semantics.

title: InMemory Indexed Caching for Distributed Data Processing
summary: This paper addresses Apache Spark's limitations in handling modern cloud-based data science workloads, attributing inefficiencies to its outdated assumptions about static datasets. It proposes an in-memory indexed caching solution to significantly improve the efficiency of distributed data processing and the performance of dataframes.

title: DataFrame QA A Universal LLM Framework on DataFrame Question Answering   Without Data Exposure
summary: This paper introduces DataFrame QA, a new task using Large Language Models (LLMs) to generate Pandas queries for data retrieval and analysis on dataframes, specifically designed for secure operation without data exposure.

title: Supercharging Distributed Computing Environments For High Performance   Data Engineering
summary: This paper explores methods to "supercharge" distributed computing environments for high-performance data engineering. It focuses on optimizing the use of Python and R dataframes in applications that are essential for the big data and artificial intelligence revolution.

title: High Performance Dataframes from Parallel Processing Patterns
summary: Dataframes are a cornerstone of data science, widely adopted for their ease of use, extensive operator coverage, and popularity (e.g., in R). This summary focuses on how to achieve high performance for these dataframes by applying various parallel processing patterns.

title: Breaking the Hidden Irreducible Polynomials Scheme
summary: This paper identifies a critical flaw in the recently proposed Hidden Irreducible Polynomials public key cryptography scheme, demonstrating how an attacker can directly recover the private key due to a design vulnerability.

title: Probability theory and publickey cryptography
summary: Clarifies a common misconception at the intersection of probability theory and public-key cryptography, enhancing understanding of how these two fields interact.

title: Publickey cryptography and invariant theory
summary: This resource explores the intersection of public-key cryptography and invariant theory, proposing new cryptosystems based on invariants of groups. It also provides an overview of existing group-based cryptosystems.

title: A SATbased Public Key Cryptography Scheme
summary: This learning summary covers a public key cryptography scheme that leverages the Boolean Satisfiability (SAT) problem. In this system, the public key is a SAT formula, satisfied by the private key. Encryption involves probabilistically generating functions that the public key implies are false, then XORing these with the message. A key feature is its homomorphic property, allowing computations on encrypted data.

title: QuantumResistant Cryptography
summary: Quantum-resistant cryptography develops cryptographic methods designed to remain secure even with the advent of large-scale fault-tolerant quantum computers. NIST is actively standardizing these Post-Quantum Cryptography (PQC) algorithms, with initial selections for the first set of algorithms expected soon.

title: Pretty Modular Symmetric Encryption PMSE compact algorithm for   embedded cryptography with quite low computational cost
summary: Nowadays the dataflux shared between IOT systems must be secured from 8bits to 64bits processors systems Several symmetric cryptographic algorithm already exist such as AES Advanced Encryption Standard RC4 Blowfish etc In this work we propose an 8bits encryption algorithm...

title: Deep CrossModal Hashing with Hashing Functions and Unified Hash Codes   Jointly Learning
summary: Due to their high retrieval efficiency and low storage cost crossmodal hashing methods have attracted considerable attention Generally compared with shallow crossmodal hashing methods deep crossmodal hashing methods can achieve a more satisfactory performance by integrating feature learning

title: Controlled Alternate Quantum Walk based Block Hash Function
summary: This paper introduces a novel **Controlled Alternate Quantum Walk based Block Hash Function**, a type of cryptographic hash function leveraging quantum walk principles. These functions are notable for their enhanced safety, flexibility, high efficiency, and compatibility, with the research specifically addressing the control mechanisms central to such quantum-based cryptographic methods.

title: Fusion Hashing A General Framework for Selfimprovement of Hashing
summary: Hashing has been widely used for efficient similarity search based on its query and storage efficiency To obtain better precision most studies focus on designing different objective functions

title: EKSTRAKTO A tool to reconstruct Dedukti proofs from TSTP files extended   abstract
summary: EKSTRAKTO is a tool designed to reconstruct detailed Dedukti proofs from TSTP files generated by automated theorem provers (ATPs). This addresses the challenge of integrating ATP-generated proofs into formal proof assistants, as ATPs often use diverse calculi and produce proof traces that lack sufficient detail.

title: Similarity Calculation Based on Homomorphic Encryption
summary: In recent years although some homomorphic encryption algorithms have been proposed to provide additive homomorphic encryption and multiplicative homomorphic encryption However similarity measures are required for searches

title: Fully Homomorphic Encryption via Affine Automorphisms
summary: Homomorphic encryption is a method used in cryptopgraphy to create programs that can interact with encrypted data without ever leaving the data in the clear This has many potential applications in cybersecurity This paper uses automorphisms of affine space

title: Revisiting Fully Homomorphic Encryption Schemes
summary: Homomorphic Encryption (HE) allows computations to be performed on encrypted data without prior decryption, ensuring privacy for sensitive information. This makes HE particularly valuable for secure operations in areas like cloud computing and medical data analysis.

title: Homomorphic Encryption Based on Lattice PostQuantum Cryptography
summary: This paper explores Homomorphic Encryption (HE) designed to resist future quantum attacks. It addresses the vulnerability of current HE methods (e.g., RSA, ElGamal) to advanced quantum computing by proposing new HE schemes built on lattice-based cryptography, which is crucial for maintaining data privacy as quantum computing technology advances.

title: Entanglementbased quantum digital signatures over deployed campus   network
summary: This resource introduces entanglement-based quantum digital signatures (QDS), a protocol designed to replace traditional public-key digital signatures. QDS offers the significant advantage of information-theoretic security. The work demonstrates its practical implementation and deployment over a real-world campus network.

title: Revocable Quantum Digital Signatures
summary: This paper introduces "Revocable Quantum Digital Signatures," a new type of digital signature where the signing key can be revoked. The construction relies on the LWE (Learning With Errors) assumption, and a key feature is that the signing key itself is a quantum state.

title: Selecting Reliable Blockchain Peers via Hybrid Blockchain Reliability   Prediction
summary: This paper addresses the challenge of connecting to reliable peers in public blockchain networks. It proposes a novel hybrid prediction method to assess blockchain reliability, enabling users to select trustworthy peers and improve network performance.

title: On the Discrete Logarithm Problem for elliptic curves over local fields
summary: This paper examines the Discrete Logarithm Problem (DLP) for elliptic curves, particularly those defined over local fields. The DLP is a foundational challenge in the security of Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC), and this research presents a new attack on it.

title: Encryption of Data using Elliptic Curve over Finite fields
summary: This material explores Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) for data encryption, focusing on how elliptic curve arithmetic over finite fields enhances the security of public-key encryption schemes by ensuring the authenticity of public keys, which is crucial for maintaining secrecy and authentication.

title: A Secure Multiple Elliptic Curves Digital Signature Algorithm for   Blockchain
summary: This paper introduces a multiple elliptic curves digital signature algorithm designed to enhance the security of blockchain and cryptocurrency systems. It addresses the vulnerability of the commonly used `secp256k1` curve, which is susceptible to potential backdoors.

title: Topic In Elliptic Curves Over Finite Fields The Groups of Points
summary: This resource provides an introductory overview of the theory behind groups of points on elliptic curves over finite fields. It covers the foundational concepts and practical applications of Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC), highlighting its role as a new generation of public key systems.

title: Study of ZeroKnowledge protocols and Elliptic Curve Cryptography and   their implementation in Smart Card environments using Java Card
summary: This paper investigates the implementation of Zero-Knowledge Protocols (ZKPs) and Elliptic Curve Cryptography (ECC) within the resource-constrained environment of smart cards, specifically utilizing Java Card technology to address computational limitations.

title: Cryptography Classical versus PostQuantum
summary: This summary explores the advantages of post-quantum cryptography over classical methods, surveying various techniques, and concludes that quantum-safe systems are the anticipated future for secure communication.

title: Realization Scheme for Visual Cryptography with Computergenerated   Holograms
summary: This paper proposes a novel method to implement visual cryptography using computer-generated holograms, offering an indirect recovery approach that aims to overcome the limitations of current film-based or computer-superposition techniques.

title: Indexing Properties of Primitive Pythagorean Triples for Cryptography   Applications
summary: This paper explores new indexing properties of Primitive Pythagorean Triples (PPTs) and discusses their applications, particularly in cryptography and for generating events with varying probabilities.

title: Investigating Design Antipattern and Design Pattern Mutations and Their   Change and Faultproneness
summary: This research investigates how inexperienced developers, during software evolution (e.g., bug fixes, new features), can inadvertently introduce design antipatterns or alter established design patterns. These changes often lead to increased faultproneness and make software systems more difficult to modify, underscoring the importance of understanding and applying sound design principles for maintainable code.

title: Request and notification Pattern for an internet banking System
summary: This paper explores the application of design patterns, specifically a "Request and Notification Pattern," to enhance the quality and reusability of software developed for internet banking systems. It highlights how using these proven, reusable components improves software quality for end-users.

title: Verification of Patterns
summary: This resource examines the verification of software patterns, which serve as essential building blocks for designing and implementing software systems and improving software engineering practices.

title: Finding Regressions in Projects under Version Control Systems
summary: This paper explores techniques for identifying and locating regressions, or unwanted behaviors, within complex large-scale software projects managed using Version Control Systems (VCS), navigating intertwined branches and numerous commits.

title: GitTheta A Git Extension for Collaborative Development of Machine   Learning Models
summary: GitTheta is a Git extension designed to enable collaborative, distributed, and iterative development of machine learning models, applying open-source software version control principles to overcome limitations of centralized ML workflows.

title: Enhancing Clinical Data Warehouses with Provenance and Large File   Management The gitOmmix Approach for Clinical Omics Data
summary: This paper introduces **gitOmmix**, an approach designed to enhance **Clinical Data Warehouses (CDWs)**. It addresses key limitations in current CDW systems, specifically their inability to effectively manage **large data files** and track **data provenance**, which are crucial for integrating **clinical omics data** for research and predictive modeling.

title: Measuring and improving information systems agility through the balanced   scorecard approach
summary: This paper emphasizes the critical role of organizational and Information Systems (IS) agility for survival and success in today's complex and uncertain environments. It introduces the Balanced Scorecard (BSC) as a strategic framework to effectively measure and improve IS agility within an organization.

title: Project Success in Agile Development Projects
summary: This paper clarifies the distinctions between Waterfall and Agile development methodologies and identifies key criteria for achieving project success in Agile projects.

title: Agile Methodology in Online Learning and How It Can Improve   Communication A Case Study
summary: This paper examines how Agile methodologies, adapted from software engineering, were applied in university online classes during the COVID-19 pandemic to improve communication.

title: Who is Debugging the Debuggers Exposing Debug Information Bugs in   Optimized Binaries
summary: Despite advancements, software bugs persist, necessitating robust debugging. This paper addresses a critical, often overlooked challenge: "debug information bugs" within optimized binaries. It highlights how inaccuracies or inconsistencies in the debug data generated by compilers can severely impede effective debugging, essentially exposing flaws in the very information debuggers rely upon to diagnose and resolve production issues.

title: Resilient SelfDebugging Software Protection
summary: Self-debugging is a software protection technique where applications detect and defend against hostile debuggers used for reverse engineering and tampering. However, existing self-debugging implementations have identifiable vulnerabilities that can be exploited.

title: Enhancing HighQuality Code Generation in Large Language Models with   Comparative PrefixTuning
summary: This paper introduces "Comparative PrefixTuning" as a method to enhance the quality of code generated by Large Language Models (LLMs). While LLMs significantly boost coding efficiency, they often produce code that fails to meet quality standards; this technique aims to mitigate such issues.

title: PreCogIIITH at HinglishEval  Leveraging CodeMixing Metrics  Language   Model Embeddings To Estimate CodeMix Quality
summary: This paper presents PreCogIIITH's approach for evaluating the quality of machine-generated code-mixed text, particularly for low-resource languages like Hinglish. It leverages a combination of specialized code-mixing metrics and language model embeddings to estimate quality, which is crucial for data augmentation in such settings.

title: An Architecture Process Maturity Model of Software Product Line   Engineering
summary: This paper introduces a maturity model for assessing and improving the architectural processes within Software Product Line Engineering (SPLE). It highlights the critical role of software architecture in developing high-quality product lines, aiming to guide organizations in maturing their architectural practices.

title: Where and What do Software Architects blog An Exploratory Study on   Architectural Knowledge in Blogs and their Relevance to Design Steps
summary: This study explores software architects' blogs as a valuable source of architectural knowledge (AK), highlighting their relevance for software design steps, despite current limited understanding of their content and nature.

title: Ambush from All Sides Understanding Security Threats in OpenSource   Software CICD Pipelines
summary: This resource examines the diverse security threats, including malicious code, that affect widely used open-source Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CICD) pipelines, despite their prevalence on Internet hosting platforms.

title: A First Look at CICD Adoptions in OpenSource Android Apps
summary: This study offers a first look at how Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) are being adopted in open-source Android applications, examining their role in streamlining software building, testing, and deployment processes.

title: CICD Configuration Practices in OpenSource Android Apps An Empirical   Study
summary: This empirical study investigates how Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CICD)—a practice for automating software builds, tests, and deployments—is configured and adopted in real-world open-source Android applications, offering insights into practical CICD implementation for mobile development.

title: Empirical Analysis on CICD Pipeline Evolution in Machine Learning   Projects
summary: This learning summary explores the empirical findings on the evolution of Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) pipelines in Machine Learning (ML) projects. It emphasizes how the increasing popularity and integration of ML components into broader software systems necessitate and shape the adoption of CI/CD practices.

title: Exploring the Impact of Integrating UI Testing in CICD Workflows on   GitHub
summary: This study explores the integration and impact of User Interface (UI) testing within Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CICD) workflows on GitHub. It addresses the current lack of understanding regarding the adoption and effects of UI testing frameworks in these automated development pipelines.

title: Assessing the BugProneness of Refactored Code A Longitudinal   MultiProject Study
summary: This study investigates the common assumption that refactoring, a practice aimed at improving code structure and maintainability, makes software code less prone to bugs. It assesses this relationship through a longitudinal, multi-project analysis.

title: Refactoring for Reuse An Empirical Study
summary: This empirical study investigates how developers actually refactor software code to promote reuse, addressing a gap in research that traditionally focuses on theoretical refactoring strategies and design patterns.

title: An Empirical Study on the Potential of LLMs in Automated Software   Refactoring
summary: This study empirically investigates the potential and performance of Large Language Models (LLMs) for automated software refactoring, examining how well they compare to existing methods.

title: An Empirical Study on RefactoringInducing Pull Requests
summary: This empirical study analyzes "refactoring-inducing" Pull Requests (PRs) within Modern Code Review (MCR). It investigates how reviewers contribute code refactorings through PR comments and commits, suggesting a differentiated perspective on PR types compared to prior research.

title: Do Developers Refactor Data Access Code An Empirical Study
summary: This empirical study investigates how developers refactor data access code in data-intensive systems, an area less explored than refactoring in traditional software systems.

title: The AINative Software Development Lifecycle A Theoretical and   Practical New Methodology
summary: This paper introduces the AINative Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), a new methodology proposed to adapt software development processes to the increasing influence and integration of AI at every stage of the SDLC.

title: Explainable Artificial Intelligence Techniques for Software Development   Lifecycle A Phasespecific Survey
summary: This paper surveys Explainable Artificial Intelligence (XAI) techniques that address the "black-box" problem of complex AI models by providing clear explanations. It specifically examines the application of XAI across different phases of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), aiming to enhance trust and facilitate better integration of AI in software development.

title: Why you shouldnt fully trust ChatGPT A synthesis of this AI tools   error rates across disciplines and the software engineering lifecycle
summary: Despite the widespread use of Large Language Models (LLMs) like ChatGPT across various fields (e.g., healthcare, business, engineering, software engineering), their documented error rates across disciplines and throughout the software engineering lifecycle highlight that they should not be fully trusted due to reliability concerns.

title: Model based system engineering approach of a lightweight embedded TCPIP
summary: This resource explores how Model-Based System Engineering (MBSE) can be applied to develop a lightweight TCP/IP stack specifically for embedded systems. It highlights the increasing need for internet connectivity in embedded software and addresses the challenge of adapting the essential TCP/IP protocol to resource-constrained environments.

title: Exploiting CrossLayer Vulnerabilities OffPath Attacks on the TCPIP   Protocol Suite
summary: This paper investigates new cross-layer, off-path vulnerabilities in the fundamental TCP/IP protocol suite, challenging its perceived robustness and security despite decades of development.

title: TCPSnitch Dissecting the Usage of the Socket API
summary: This paper, titled "TCPSnitch," analyzes how networked applications utilize the Socket API to interact with the TCPIP stack, discussing the API's historical extensions and proposing a method to dissect its usage.

title: Universal Session Protocol A General Solution to Remote Code Execution
summary: The Universal Session Protocol (USP) is proposed to mitigate Remote Code Execution (RCE) vulnerabilities by addressing a fundamental flaw in the TCPIP model. Currently, TCPIP allows anonymous connection requests, with authentication occurring *within* applications. USP aims to make authentication a mandatory *precondition* for establishing any network connection, thereby preventing anonymous access and significantly reducing the attack surface for RCE exploits.

title: Derivation of Network Reprogramming Protocol with Z3
summary: This work explores the derivation of network reprogramming protocols, focusing on a method for synthesizing efficient network protocols directly from high-level requirements to maximize network utilization. The use of Z3 indicates the application of formal methods, likely a satisfiability modulo theories (SMT) solver, to aid in the automated and verified generation of these protocols.

title: Anonymous communication protocol over quantum networks
summary: This paper introduces a W state-based protocol for anonymous quantum communication within quantum networks, designed for effective implementation and offering an alternative to existing methods.

title: Classification and Characterization of Core Grid Protocols for Global   Grid Computing
summary: This paper classifies and characterizes core grid protocols, providing a structured understanding of the many new protocols that have emerged due to increasing research in global grid computing.

title: Finding Security Vulnerabilities in Network Protocol Implementations
summary: This paper explores common security vulnerabilities in network protocol implementations, stemming from developer errors in memory access and arithmetic operations. It highlights the ongoing challenge of developing practical methods to effectively identify and mitigate these flaws.

title: PAR Petal ant routing algorithm for mobile ad hoc network
summary: The PAR Petal ant routing algorithm is a routing protocol for Mobile Ad Hoc Networks (MANETs) designed to optimize route discovery. It focuses on efficiently handling the broadcasting of route request and reply packets to establish paths between nodes, utilizing an ant colony optimization-inspired approach.

title: Stateless and Delivery Guaranteed Geometric Routing on Virtual   Coordinate System
summary: This paper presents a stateless, delivery-guaranteed geometric routing protocol that utilizes a virtual coordinate system. This method addresses performance issues like physical voids and localization errors common in traditional geographic routing, while retaining its benefits of low overhead.

title: 5G Network Security Practices An Overview and Survey
summary: This document provides an overview and survey of 5G network security practices, detailing the architecture of the 5G core network and the security services offered by its various components.

title: 5GFlow Flexible and Efficient 5G RAN Architecture Using OpenFlow
summary: 5GFlow is a proposed 5G Radio Access Network (RAN) architecture that uses OpenFlow to enhance flexibility and efficiency. It aims to support the convergence of diverse access technologies for 5G services, complementing the 3GPP 5G common core.

title: Advanced Penetration Testing for Enhancing 5G Security
summary: This paper explores the significant advancements 5G networks offer in speed, reliability, and connectivity, which are poised to revolutionize various sectors through real-time data processing. However, it emphasizes that the rapid deployment of 5G necessitates advanced penetration testing to proactively identify and mitigate vulnerabilities, thereby enhancing overall 5G security.

title: Review of 5G capabilities for smart manufacturing
summary: 5G technology is developed to support new use cases beyond traditional mobile broadband, focusing on industrial applications like smart manufacturing. These industrial requirements were specifically integrated into 5G standardization.

title: Padding Aint Enough Assessing the Privacy Guarantees of Encrypted DNS
summary: This paper assesses the privacy guarantees of encrypted DNS protocols like DoT and DoH. It highlights that while these methods encrypt DNS traffic to hide resolutions from passive adversaries, they are still vulnerable to privacy attacks, indicating that encryption alone is insufficient for robust privacy protection.
