title: Enhanced Performance and Privacy via ResolverLess DNS
summary: This paper introduces ResolverLess DNS as a method to improve web performance by reducing domain name resolution delays and enhance user privacy by eliminating the monitoring risks associated with traditional recursive DNS resolvers.

title: Exploring the Ecosystem of DNS HTTPS Resource Records An EndtoEnd   Perspective
summary: The DNS HTTPS resource record is a new DNS record type that delivers configuration and parameters needed to initiate HTTPS network service connections. It is a critical enabler for TLS Encrypted ClientHello (ECH).

title: A Survey on DNS Encryption Current Development Malware Misuse and   Inference Techniques
summary: This summary explores the critical role of the Domain Name System (DNS) in internet communication, explaining how it translates domain names to IP addresses. It highlights the security implications of unencrypted DNS queries and surveys the evolving landscape of DNS encryption, addressing its current development, malware misuse, and various inference techniques.

title: Charting Censorship Resilience and Global Internet Reachability A   Quantitative Approach
summary: This study quantitatively analyzes how Internet network topology and architecture influence both censorship resilience and global Internet reachability, addressing an underexplored area in current research.

title: Internet Anomaly Detection based on Complex Network Path
summary: This paper introduces a novel approach to detect Internet anomalies (such as network failures or attacks) by leveraging complex network path analysis, offering an alternative method to traditional traffic-based detection techniques for large-scale internet environments.

title: Modeling the Internets LargeScale Topology
summary: This paper explores the challenge of creating realistic network models (generators) that accurately represent the Internet's vast structure. Such models are vital for developing better routing protocols and understanding internet traffic. The main hurdle is our limited knowledge of the underlying forces that shape the Internet's large-scale topology.

title: Chinese Internet ASlevel Topology
summary: This study presents the first comprehensive mapping of the Chinese Internet's Autonomous System (AS) level topology. It details the methodology, which relies on traceroute data collected from major Internet Service Providers (ISPs) within mainland China.

title: A Brief Study of Computer Network Security Technologies
summary: This study explores the security implications of rapid computer network development, highlighting how convenience is balanced by new threats. It focuses specifically on general network system security challenges.

title: Cost Efficiency Optimization of 5G Wireless Backhaul Networks
summary: Learn about optimizing cost efficiency in 5G wireless backhaul networks. This is crucial for urban 5G deployment, enabling ultra-dense small cell networks to meet growing user demands through effective deployment and management.

title: Design of LinkQualitypredictionbased SoftwareDefined Wireless Sensor   Networks
summary: This paper addresses the instability of wireless links in multihop networks, including Software-Defined Wireless Sensor Networks (SDWSN), by proposing a design that incorporates link quality prediction to improve network stability.

title: What is A Wireless UAV A Design Blueprint for 6G Flying Wireless Nodes
summary: This resource examines the evolution of Wireless Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) from their introduction as cellular users in 4G networks to their role in 5G. It then details a design blueprint for UAVs to function as "flying wireless nodes" in future 6G systems, highlighting their critical and evolving importance in wireless communication infrastructure.

title: Trailing the Snail SDN Controller Security Evolution
summary: This learning summary traces the evolution of Software-Defined Networking (SDN) controllers, including their security development. It highlights NOX by Nicira Networks as the pioneering OpenFlow SDN controller and notes the significant growth over approximately a decade, leading to at least 29 open-source SDN controllers available today.

title: AtomicSDN Is Synchronous Flooding the Solution to SoftwareDefined   Networking in IoT
summary: AtomicSDN investigates whether synchronous flooding is the optimal solution for implementing Software-Defined Networking (SDN) in Internet of Things (IoT) environments. This research explores how SDN, known for its ability to manage diverse network resources and allow easy reconfiguration, can be effectively applied to IoT.

title: Embedded vs External Controllers in SoftwareDefined IoT Networks
summary: Software-Defined Networking (SDN) provides a flexible and programmable architecture for modern networks, including IoT. This topic explores the critical design choice between using embedded or external controllers in Software-Defined IoT Networks, examining how this impacts network programmability and device communication.

title: Integrated NFVSDN Architectures A Systematic Literature Review
summary: This systematic literature review explores integrated architectures of Network Functions Virtualization (NFV) and Software-Defined Networking (SDN), identifying them as key paradigms for evolving towards open network software and hardware, with NFV specifically enabling the virtualization of network functions.

title: A Survey on SDN  SDCN Traffic Measurement Existing Approaches and   Research Challenge
summary: This survey explores existing approaches and research challenges in traffic measurement within Software-Defined Networks (SDN) and Software-Defined Cloud Networks (SDCN). SDN, characterized by its decoupled control and data planes and OpenFlow protocol, represents the next generation of networking.

title: Probabilistic Quality of Service aware Service Selection
summary: This paper explores how to intelligently select software services in dynamic, cloud-based (Software-as-a-Service) environments. It focuses on choosing services that meet specific Quality of Service (QoS) requirements (e.g., performance, reliability) by using a *probabilistic* approach to account for the inherent uncertainty and variability in how these services might perform. The goal is to ensure the combined services achieve a common business objective effectively.

title: Achieve Better Ranking Accuracy Using CloudRank Framework for Cloud   Services
summary: CloudRank is a framework designed to improve the accuracy of Quality of Service (QoS) ranking for cloud services. This is essential for developing high-quality cloud applications by better evaluating the non-functional performance of remotely invoked services.

title: MultiObjective Service Composition in Ubiquitous Environments with   Service Dependencies
summary: This paper explores **multi-objective service composition** in **ubiquitous computing environments**. It details how to combine various hardware and software services to achieve complex user tasks, while managing **service dependencies** and optimizing for the best **Quality of Service (QoS)**.

title: CHESTNUT A QoS Dataset for Mobile Edge Environments
summary: This paper introduces CHESTNUT, a new dataset designed to measure Quality of Service (QoS) in mobile edge computing environments. QoS is vital for evaluating network service performance, especially when mobile devices interact with edge servers.

title: From Civil Engineering to Computer Vision Building AI That Solves Real Counting Problems
summary: Discover how computer vision AI can automate real-world counting challenges, such as warehouse inventory, and the journey from civil engineering to building these practical AI solutions.

title: How to Train YOLOv13 on Custom Datasets
summary: Learn to train YOLOv13 on custom datasets, focusing on hypergraph-enhanced object detection.

title: Teaching AI to Recognize Fruits with CNN A Beginners Deep Learning Project
summary: Learn to build a deep learning model using Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) to enable AI to recognize fruits, designed as a beginner-friendly project.

title: Visual TransformersViT Explained How Vision Models Are Learning Like Language Models
summary: Learn about Visual Transformers (ViT), including their architecture and how they apply language model principles to computer vision. Discover why ViT is replacing Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs).

title: YOLOv13 Is Out All You Need To Know
